title: Billie Eilish brands fans ‘mean’ after backlash to BTS collab idea
text:
Billie isn’t here for her fans being ‘mean’ about the K-Pop stars (Picture: Getty; MTV)

Billie Eilish has defended BTS after fans were less than impressed about a potential collaboration between the artists.

It seems some people are against the idea and we’re struggling to comprehend why.

The K-Pop heroes have made no secret of the fact that they’re fans of Billie’s but, when the 17-year-old gauged what fans reckon about a collab at Austin City Limits festival, the crowd were less than enthusiastic, with people actually shouting ‘No.’

And Billie was having absolutely none of it.

When @billieeilish asked who she should work with…I said @bts_bighit because they like her alot….however the crowd was meh over it🙄 She said she'd listen to them! But if there's ever a collab between the two…"You're Welcome💁🏻‍♀️" That was me! #btsartmy @aclfestival pic.twitter.com/nQFbc929kd — sanantoniostephanie (@Steph_In_Texas) October 6, 2019

‘Stop! Oh, my god, that is so mean, I’m gonna listen to them,’ she pointed out. ‘They’re very nice. They’ve said some very nice things about me.’

And fans of the star also had some strong words for those in the crowd.

‘So Billie Eilish asked her fans if she should collab with BTS and the crowd screamed no…….. Let me stating facts again : locals don’t deserve rights [sic],’ one wrote on Twitter.

‘Locals are so pressed while billie just their chillin saying stan bts [sic],’ another added.

‘I hope Billie collabs with BTS 7 times so the stans who booed here can choke,’ one more said.

Chatting to Apple Beats 1 radio back in April, BTS star Jungkook specifically named Billie as someone the band would love to collab with.

The K-Pop heroes are no strangers to a collab (Picture: Getty Images)

Talking about her debut album, he said that ‘everyone should hear it.’

No lies detected.

The beloved K-Pop stars are no stranger to a cheeky collab, after seeing huge success with theirs and Halsey’s track Boy With Luv.

Billie told her fans to stop being ‘mean’ (Picture: WireImage)

Meanwhile, the band’s recent song Chicken Noodle Soup with Becky G pretty much broke the internet, with fans taking to TikTok to show off their moves to the new hit.

And it seems the boys are in high demand after artists including Stormzy have been calling on them for a collab.

While it’s no secret that the rapper is a bit of a superfan, he asked the lads to hit him up while they were in London for their Love Yourself: Speak Yourself Tour.

After a Twitter user alerted him to BTS’ trip to London, Stormzy replied: ‘Yooo @BTS_twt gimme a shout lads,’ with the phone emoji.

Do it for the ARMY, boys.
